direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with the tracking of errors, but one enables/disables it while the other checks its status.
Both methods interact with the errors list, with setTrackErrors modifying it and getErrors retrieving it.
Both methods modify the state of the Parser object by enabling or disabling a tracking feature.
Both methods check the state of tracking features, but for different aspects (errors vs. position).
Both methods can affect the state of the Parser object, particularly in how errors are tracked during parsing.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the parser might involve setting up error tracking, which is relevant for setTrackErrors.
Parsing input might involve tracking errors, so setTrackErrors should be invoked before or after parsing.
After setting the error tracking, retrieving the errors can be used to verify the state and content of the errors list.
